com.mesosphere.sdk.state

Class FrameworkStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.state.FrameworkStore

  • public class FrameworkStore
extends java.lang.Object
    A FrameworkStore stores the Framework ID for the scheduler. The framework ID is required for the scheduler to re-identify itself with Mesos after initial registration.

    The structure used in the underlying persister is as follows:
    rootPath/
     -> FrameworkID

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FrameworkStore(Persister persister)
      Creates a new FrameworkStore which uses the provided Persister to access the Framework ID.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearFrameworkId()
      Removes any previously stored FrameworkID or does nothing if no FrameworkID was previously stored.
      java.util.Optional<Protos.FrameworkID> fetchFrameworkId()
      Fetches the previously stored FrameworkID, or returns an empty Optional if no FrameworkId was previously stored.
      Persister getPersister()
      Returns the underlying Persister.
      void storeFrameworkId(Protos.FrameworkID fwkId)
      Stores the FrameworkID for a framework so on Scheduler restart re-registration may occur.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Creates a new FrameworkStore which uses the provided Persister to access the Framework ID.

        persister - The persister which holds the data

    • Method Detail

      • getPersister

        public Persister getPersister()
        Returns the underlying Persister.

      • storeFrameworkId

        public void storeFrameworkId(Protos.FrameworkID fwkId)
                      throws StateStoreException
        Stores the FrameworkID for a framework so on Scheduler restart re-registration may occur.
        Parameters:
        fwkId - FrameworkID to be store
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - when storing the FrameworkID fails

      • clearFrameworkId

        public void clearFrameworkId()
                      throws StateStoreException
        Removes any previously stored FrameworkID or does nothing if no FrameworkID was previously stored.
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - when clearing a FrameworkID fails

      • fetchFrameworkId

        public java.util.Optional<Protos.FrameworkID> fetchFrameworkId()
                                                        throws StateStoreException
        Fetches the previously stored FrameworkID, or returns an empty Optional if no FrameworkId was previously stored.
        Returns:
        The previously stored FrameworkID, or an empty Optional indicating the FrameworkID has not been set.
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - when fetching the FrameworkID fails
